text.p: Finnish prefabricated logwood housemaker Honkarakenne Oy said on Tuesday it expected financial performance in the final part of the year to lift full-year earnings clearly above last year's level.
"The end-year result will lift the full-year result to clearly above last year's," it said in a statement with its Janyary-August interim results.
It said exports' share of orders was over 15 percent larger than last year and that this boosted margins.
"Growth in wood construction will increase demand for lowgood houses and that may even be seen as a more positive development than expected," it said.
"The sector's outlook has improved both in Finland and in exports," it said.
But it warned that if raw wood prices were to rise more than expected, margins would fall and tnext year's result expectations would be dented.
